newsitem.title: USA: Jesse Jackson calls for end to Texaco boycott.
newsitem.headline: Jesse Jackson calls for end to Texaco boycott.

text.p: The Rev. Jesse Jackson Wednesday called for an end to a consumer boycott of Texaco Inc., saying the oil company had a workable plan to boost employment of minorities and purchasing from minority firms.
"We now have a sufficiently comprehensive and workable plan to call an end to the consumer boycott," Jackson said at a news conference.
"Texaco is on a journey from tragedy to triumph. The journey is incomplete but they have changed their course," Jackson said.

Texaco's plan to improve treatment of minority employees and contractors comes after the company agreed last month to settle a racial discrimation suit by paying $176.1 million and establishing an "equality and tolerance" task force.
Plaintiffs' lawyers in the lawsuit had received secret tapes of senior executives discussing destruction of damaging documents. The executives allegedly also made racist remarks.
While Jackson called off the boycott, the civil rights leader said his Rainbow Coalition plans to continue to monitor progress at Texaco, one of the nation's largest oil companies.
